intro: Alchemilla grisebachiana, commonly known as the gray alchemilla, is a perennial plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features dark green, oval-shaped leaves with a silvery-gray underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early summer, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Alchemilla grisebachiana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
